and closed‐form ridge regression for stable, efficient fitting.

import numpy as np

def scaling_law_func(data_points, params):
    """
    Predict LM loss from hyperparameters via a log-linear power law:
      loss ≈ exp(beta0 + β1·log(lr) + β2·log(bsz) + β3·log(data_size) + β4·log(param_size))
    Args:
      data_points: array-like of shape (N,4) => [lr, bsz, data_size, non_embedding_param_size]
      params:      array of shape (5,) or (T,5), each row = [beta0, β1, β2, β3, β4]
    Returns:
      preds: (N,) if params is 1D, or (N,T) if params is 2D
    """
    X = np.atleast_2d(np.asarray(data_points, dtype=float))
    # ensure strictly positive inputs for log
    X = np.clip(X, 1e-12, None)
    logX = np.log(X)                     # (N,4)
    
    p = np.asarray(params, dtype=float)
    if p.ndim == 1:
        p = p[None, :]
    T, P = p.shape
    # Expect P == 1 (intercept) + 4 features
    assert P == logX.shape[1] + 1, f"Expected params shape (*,5), got {p.shape}"
    
    beta0 = p[:, 0]                      # (T,)
    betas = p[:, 1:]                     # (T,4)
    # Compute beta0 + logX · betas^T, shape (N,T)
    lin = logX.dot(betas.T) + beta0[None, :]
    loss_pred = np.exp(lin)
    
    # If only one parameter vector, return shape (N,)
    if loss_pred.shape[1] == 1:
        return loss_pred[:, 0]
    return loss_pred


def fit_scaling_law(data_points, loss_values):
    """
    Fit the log-linear power-law model via ridge regression:
      log(loss) ≈ beta0 + β1·log(lr) + β2·log(bsz) + β3·log(data_size) + β4·log(param_size)
    Args:
      data_points: array-like of shape (N,4)
      loss_values: array-like of shape (N,) or (N,T)
    Returns:
      params: array of shape (5,) if single-output, or (T,5) for multi-output
    """
    X = np.atleast_2d(np.asarray(data_points, dtype=float))
    y = np.asarray(loss_values, dtype=float)
    N, F = X.shape
    
    # Log-transform inputs
    X = np.clip(X, 1e-12, None)
    logX = np.log(X)                     # (N,4)

    if y.ndim == 1:
        y2d = y[:, None]
    else:
        y2d = y
    y2d = np.clip(y2d, 1e-12, None)
    logY = np.log(y2d)                   # (N,T)
    T = logY.shape[1]
    
    # Design matrix with intercept
    Z = np.concatenate([np.ones((N, 1)), logX], axis=1)  # (N,5)
    P = F + 1                                           # 5 parameters
    
    # Ridge regularization parameter
    ridge_lambda = 1e-6
    
    # Closed-form ridge regression: (Z^T Z + λI)^{-1} Z^T logY
    ZTZ = Z.T.dot(Z)
    ZTZ.flat[::P+1] += ridge_lambda
    ZTY = Z.T.dot(logY)
    betas = np.linalg.solve(ZTZ, ZTY)   # Shape (5,T)
    
    # Return proper shape

        return betas[:, 0]

    y2d = np.clip(y2d, 1e-12, None)
    logY = np.log(y2d)                   # (N,T)
    T = logY.shape[1]
    
    # Design matrix with intercept
    Z = np.concatenate([np.ones((N, 1)), logX], axis=1)  # (N,5)
    P = F + 1                                           # 5 parameters
    
    # Ridge regularization parameter
    ridge_lambda = 1e-6
    
    # Closed-form ridge regression: (Z^T Z + λI)^{-1} Z^T logY
    ZTZ = Z.T.dot(Z)
    ZTZ.flat[::P+1] += ridge_lambda
    ZTY = Z.T.dot(logY)
    betas = np.linalg.solve(ZTZ, ZTY)   # Shape (5,T)
    
    # Return proper shape
    if T == 1:
        return betas[:, 0]
    return betas.T
